file_content.text: This... isn't possible. You aren't even human! You're no match for a Sith.
How... how can this be? You're only human. No match for the power of a full-blood Sith.
Things didn't have to happen this way, Torius.
You should've surrendered.
Ugh... be quiet. I'll hear no more from you.
All that time worrying about the Voss--and for nothing.
Didn't plan for this, huh?
You are unworthy of my notice. A nothing. An insect.
This isn't finished. I cannot... be killed by vermin like you. I... I....
He's gone. Looks like we're clear.
No pulse... no breathing. He's dead, sir.
Yet another enemy of democracy is felled by the hands of Havoc Squad!
So much for him. I'll start planting charges--nobody's going to find these bodies.
The Sith dies as he lived, consumed from within by hatred and jealousy.
Looks like I'm more than a match.
Good last words. [Kill Torius]
Argh!
That's that. Looks like we're done here.
Well, he's dead, sir. In case you had any doubt.
Thus to all enemies of the Republic!
Nice shot. I'll set some charges--the Voss will never find the bodies.
You have ushered the Sith to his final destination. He is ended.
Major.
What are you doing here?
Gon-Sa?
I can explain everything! Really!
This isn't what it looks like!
For what purpose?
You knew these guys were putting a bomb under your capital?
Nice of you to stop by.
We knew.
The Mystic, Ki-Ve, foresaw Lord Torius's actions, and yours. Voss is safe.
The Republic was happy to help you deal with this threat.
I'm glad to hear that.
There is more.
If you knew about the threat, why didn't you do anything?
Why didn't you help?
Ki-Ve saw no need for help.
You didn't foresee anything. You're just here to take credit.
I don't buy it.
Belief is irrelevant.
Ki-Ve comes to see this bomb. Its technology is unknown.
Give us the bomb for study. We will give weaponry in trade.
This is top secret Republic technology. I'm not authorized to give it away.
I'm afraid I can't.
I can't just hand you an orbital strike bomb.
No way!
Then we leave.
I'll get retrieval on the comm, get this thing taken somewhere safe.
Contacting Republic retrieval team to return this fine piece of engineering to the proper authorities.
Here, I'll call in some heavy lifters to get this beauty home. I like to keep their info handy for times like these.
I'll have a class-seven retrieval team brought to our coordinates straight away, Major.
Yuun will summon reinforcements to return this device to its true home at last.
Looks like you could use a hand. I'll get retrieval to send a team on the double.
Dorne, here, sir. A class-seven retrieval team is en route to your coordinates. Please stand by.
Major. Looks like you got us a real treat here. Jak, Garen, check those rad seals, would you?
We can handle things from here, sir. Feel free to head back to Senator Evran's office.
The ZR-57 is all yours.
Sure. For diplomacy's sake.
Here. Voss commando equipment. The finest.
You will go now.
Ah, Major. I rather suspected our paths might cross again, though not like this.
I must give Senator Evran credit--sending you here was a bolder move than I expected from him.
Your plan is finished. Give it up.
It's over, Torius.
I think you overestimate your chances.
Evran authorized all necessary force, so don't try anything.
Sometimes people surprise you.
What Evran "authorizes" is no concern of mine.
I didn't come here to chat.
Shut up.
No. I can feel your singular focus... your bloodthirsty determination.
Don't you think it's odd that you're the only one trying to stop me? That the Voss haven't foreseen everything, as they supposedly can?
With this weapon buried beneath their capital, the Voss will have no choice but to submit. Clearly their abilities were no match for the power of the dark side.
I won't let you hold this planet hostage, Torius.
You haven't won yet.
The people of Voss already belong to the Empire--they just don't know it yet.
Is that the ZR-57 stolen by the Havoc Squad traitors?
Where'd you get the bomb?
Yes. The orbital strike device--finally reactivated. A beautiful machine.
Congratulations, you proved the crackpot aliens wrong.
I knew it was all bunk.
Oh, their prophecies are real enough. I've merely circumvented them.
Every detail of the operation was chosen at random from dozens of fully developed alternatives. With all possibilities equal, no single plot was foreseen.
This operation has been a masterpiece of ingenuity--one that you have no place in. Guards, remove this filth.
If you surrender now, Torius, it will go much easier.
This is your last chance.
No wonder Evran could get you to come here. You truly are insane. Guards?
You're going to need a lot more guards, Torius.
Is that all you've got?
If I'm forced to dispatch you myself, all the better. Guards?
You're dead.
You'll have to settle for a rapid death. Guards?
